title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Ramiro Magno. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004)
title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004)
text: rutledge R data package provides real-time PCR raw fluorescence data Rutledge et al. (2004) tidy format. eponymous data set rutledge comprises six-point, ten-fold dilution series repeated 5 independent runs. run, concentration four replicates. total 240 amplification curves, 212 curves 45 cycles long 28 curves 35 cycles long . data two targets (amplicons): K1/K2, 102 bp, K3/K2, 218 bp.

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004)
text: Install rutledge CRAN: can install development version rutledge like :

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004)
text: rutledge provided tidy data set, long format, .e. row amplication curve point (cycle/fluor). rutledge data set comprises 240 amplification curves: 2 amplicons × 5 runs (plates) × 6 dilution levels × 4 replicates.
code: library(rutledge) rutledge #> # A tibble: 10,800 × 10 #>    plate well  dye   target sample_type replicate   copies dilution cycle  fluor #>    <fct> <fct> <chr> <fct>  <fct>           <int>    <int>    <int> <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     1 0      #>  2 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     2 0      #>  3 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     3 0      #>  4 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     4 0      #>  5 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     5 0.0007 #>  6 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     6 0.0022 #>  7 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     7 0.0005 #>  8 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     8 0.0047 #>  9 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     9 0.0107 #> 10 1     <NA>  SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1    10 0.0203 #> # ℹ 10,790 more rows rutledge |>   dplyr::count(plate, target, copies, replicate) #> # A tibble: 240 × 5 #>    plate target copies replicate     n #>    <fct> <fct>   <int>     <int> <int> #>  1 1     K1/K2     417         1    45 #>  2 1     K1/K2     417         2    45 #>  3 1     K1/K2     417         3    45 #>  4 1     K1/K2     417         4    45 #>  5 1     K1/K2    4170         1    45 #>  6 1     K1/K2    4170         2    45 #>  7 1     K1/K2    4170         3    45 #>  8 1     K1/K2    4170         4    45 #>  9 1     K1/K2   41700         1    45 #> 10 1     K1/K2   41700         2    45 #> # ℹ 230 more rows  rutledge |>   ggplot(mapping = aes(     x = cycle,     y = fluor,     group = interaction(plate, target, copies, replicate),     col = as.character(copies)   )) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.2) +   geom_point(size = 0.2) +   labs(y = "Raw fluorescence", colour = "No. of copies", title = "Six-point 10-fold dilution series") +   guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(linewidth = 0.5), reverse = TRUE)) +   facet_grid(rows = vars(plate), cols = vars(target)) #> Warning: Removed 280 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`). #> Warning: Removed 280 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004)
text: Please note rutledge project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004)
text: R. G. Rutledge. Sigmoidal curve-fitting redefines quantitative real-time PCR prospective developing automated high-throughput applications. Nucleic Acids Research 32:e178 (2004). doi: 10.1093/nar/gnh177.

what: rutledge: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004) — rutledge-package
title: rutledge: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004) — rutledge-package
text: Real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) data Rutledge et al. (2004) doi:10.1093/nar/gnh177  tidy format. data comprises six-point, ten-fold dilution series, repeated five independent runs, two different amplicons. run, standard concentration replicated four times. original raw data file see Supplementary Data section: https://academic.oup.com/nar/article/32/22/e178/2375678#supplementary-data.

title: rutledge: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Rutledge et al. (2004) — rutledge-package
text: Maintainer: Ramiro Magno rmagno@pattern.institute (ORCID) contributors: Pattern Institute [copyright holder, funder]

what: qPCR data set by Rutledge et al. (2004) — rutledge
title: qPCR data set by Rutledge et al. (2004) — rutledge
text: data set comprises six-point, ten-fold dilution series, repeated five independent runs, two different amplicons: K1/K2, 102 bp, K3/K2, 218 bp. Fluorescence readings exported background subtraction via baseline averaging 5 cycles immediately preceding cycles fluorescence first detected. Please read Materials Methods section Rutledge et al. (2004) details.

title: qPCR data set by Rutledge et al. (2004) — rutledge
text: tibble 10,800 rows 10 variables: plate Plate identifier. one plate (run) used per dilution series, plate values simply numbered 1 thru 5. well Well identifier. Values always NA (available). variable kept nevertheless coherent data sets similar R data packages. dye type dye used. data set values always "SYBR", meaning SYBR Green master mix (Roche). target Target identifier: amplicon used, K1/K2 K3/K2. sample_type Sample type (curves standards, .e. "std"). replicate Replicate identifier: 1 thru 4. copies Standard copy number. dilution Dilution factor. Higher number means greater dilution. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values.

title: qPCR data set by Rutledge et al. (2004) — rutledge
text: doi:10.1093/nar/gnh177

title: qPCR data set by Rutledge et al. (2004) — rutledge
code: rutledge #> # A tibble: 10,800 × 10 #>    plate well  dye   target sample_type replicate   copies dilution cycle  fluor #>    <fct> <fct> <chr> <fct>  <fct>           <int>    <int>    <int> <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     1 0      #>  2 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     2 0      #>  3 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     3 0      #>  4 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     4 0      #>  5 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     5 0.0007 #>  6 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     6 0.0022 #>  7 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     7 0.0005 #>  8 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     8 0.0047 #>  9 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1     9 0.0107 #> 10 1     NA    SYBR  K1/K2  std                 1 41700000        1    10 0.0203 #> # ℹ 10,790 more rows
